top.author: @Tariere5
top.text: If your system is clean? AI becomes like an extra ops teammate that never sleeps. Simple examples Agent checks tasks stuck too long â†’ pings the owner Summarizes client feedback â†’ turns it into action items Sorts inbox chaos â†’ routes requests into your task system

options.comment: The inbox chaos â†’ task system part hits different. Most people's email is where good intentions go to die ğŸ’€
The key insight here is 'clean system' - AI automation only works when your foundation is solid. Garbage in, garbage out still applies to the smartest agents.
As someone building email tools, that inbox chaos â†’ task routing example is exactly what we're obsessed with. The gap between 'saw it' and 'did it' is where productivity goes to die.

top.author: @elralfchristian
top.text: Absolutely the worst kind of marketing. It's cheap, scream desperation and you don't care if people want your mail. And everybody knows it. If you want to destroy the relationship with your potential customers on day one, spam their inbox

options.comment: The irony is that most people's first instinct when getting spammed is to block the sender forever. Congrats, you just anti-marketed yourself out of existence ğŸ¤¡
The problem runs deeper - most companies don't even realize how much their spam campaigns damage their brand equity. Short-term thinking for long-term reputation damage.
As someone building email tools, this hits hard. The amount of promotional noise drowning out actually important messages is insane - people miss genuine opportunities because of this spam fatigue.

top.author: @BaekYoonSK
top.text: Hello po! 1st batch ready for pickup tomorrow! Please check your emails (SPAM inbox, too) and our Masterlist for tracking numbers! Toram canâ€™t wait for yâ€™all to receive your copies of Irreconcilable Differences!

options.comment: The fact that you have to remind people to check SPAM says everything about email in 2024 ğŸ˜…
Smart to mention both inbox AND spam folder - so many important shipping notifications get filtered wrong these days. Hope the pickup goes smoothly!
As someone who deals with email delivery daily, the "check SPAM too" reminder hits different - so many important notifications get buried there!

top.author: @tmiyatake1
top.text: Google Chrome's Gemini feature update. It includes functions such as generating images with Nano Banana based on images on the site, automatically generating and sending emails from pages like Google Docs, and allowing the AI agent to automatically control the browser.

comments.tweetTranslationZh: Google Chrome çš„ Gemini åŠŸèƒ½æ›´æ–°ã€‚åŒ…æ‹¬åŸºäºç½‘ç«™å›¾ç‰‡ç”Ÿæˆ Nano Banana å›¾åƒã€ä» Google Docs ç­‰é¡µé¢è‡ªåŠ¨ç”Ÿæˆå’Œå‘é€é‚®ä»¶ï¼Œä»¥åŠå…è®¸ AI ä»£ç†è‡ªåŠ¨æ§åˆ¶æµè§ˆå™¨ç­‰åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚

options.comment: The auto email generation from Docs is interesting - wonder how it handles context and tone. Browser AI agents controlling tabs feels like the next logical step though.
Nano Banana sounds like someone's internal codename that accidentally made it to production ğŸŒ

As someone building email tools, the auto-generation from Docs is fascinating. The real challenge is getting the context and recipient relationship right - humans are still pretty good at that nuance.

top.author: @getgenieai
top.text: Revolutionize your inbox with #GetGenie AI Email Assistants! Use NLP & ML to draft personalized responses, summarize emails, prioritize tasks, and support 8 languages. Boost productivity & save time! Best for copywriting: https:// getgenie.ai/ai-email-assis tants/ â€¦ #AIEmail #Productivity

options.comment: The future of email is definitely AI-powered! Love seeing more tools tackling inbox overwhelm ğŸ“§âœ¨
Email summarization and task prioritization are game-changers. The multilingual support is particularly interesting - global teams need this.
As someone building email tools, it's exciting to see the space evolving. Email-to-task workflows are where the real productivity gains happen.

top.author: @TheGamerSection
top.text: Calling all #IndieDevs! We want to feature your game on our #YouTube channel. Interested in sharing your journey and insights? DM us or email gamersectionpodcast@gmail.com to get featured! #GameDev #IndieGame #GamingCommunity

options.comment: Love seeing platforms that actually care about showcasing indie talent! The best games often come from the most unexpected places ğŸ®
This is exactly what the indie dev community needs - more visibility and storytelling opportunities. The journey behind games is often as fascinating as the games themselves.
As someone building tools for creators, I love seeing this kind of outreach. Managing all the emails from interested devs is probably going to be quite the project though! ğŸ“§

top.author: @xMikeMickelson
top.text: gog + claude code = finally letting ai manage my inbox chaos spent 2 years building janky zapier workflows for this google workspace + llm was inevitable. just took forever.

options.comment: 2 years of zapier band-aids just to get what should've been native from day one ğŸ˜…
The fact that we're still patching together LLM + email in 2024 shows how broken the inbox paradigm is. Everyone's building the same workflows independently.
This is exactly why we started building email tools - everyone was duct-taping AI onto Gmail instead of reimagining the whole experience. The zapier pain is too real.

ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®é€šçŸ¥å•é¡Œã€çµæ§‹æ·±åˆ»ã§ã™ã‚ˆã­ã€‚Gmailã®æ–¹ãŒé€šçŸ¥åˆ¶å¾¡ã‚‚ç´°ã‹ãè¨­å®šã§ãã¦å®‰å®šã—ã¦ã‚‹å°è±¡ã§ã™

top.author: @SafockAI
top.text: AI can turn 3 hours of work into 15 minutes. Need to summarize a 50 page report? Done. Translate a document? Instant. Generate 10 email variations? Seconds. It handles the repetitive stuff while you handle the thinking.

options.comment: The future is here and it's making us all look like productivity wizards âœ¨ Though I still spend 2 hours deciding which of the 10 AI email variations to actually send

This is exactly why I think the future of work isn't about AI replacing humans, but about AI amplifying human judgment. The compression of execution time means we can spend more cycles on strategy and creative problem-solving.

As someone building email tools, the 'generate 10 email variations' part hits different. We're exploring how AI can help not just with drafting, but with understanding which tone actually matches the context. The speed is amazing, but the judgment layer is where it gets interesting.

top.author: @AliceJiaox2

top.author: @jeoste_
top.text: My client just sent me this satisfying email about my "slow shipping" But if I tell my client I need 4 days to do the feature, and they pay me to work 1 day per week, then why are they not happy that it takes 1 month to ship (???)

top.author: @m0370
top.text: Looking at the email header, DKIM and DMARC are set up, but the sending mail server doesnâ€™t have SPF configured at all! No wonder Gmail marks it as spam. The quoted-printable encoding with ISO-2022-JP also feels a bit outdated. I bet the chances of getting flagged as spam are

options.comment: SPF is like the forgotten middle child of email auth - everyone remembers DKIM and DMARC but somehow SPF gets left behind ğŸ˜…

Classic case of partial email auth implementation. SPF is often the most overlooked despite being arguably the easiest to set up. The ISO-2022-JP encoding definitely doesn't help with modern spam filters either.

As someone building email tools, we see this SPF gap constantly - it's wild how often the 'easiest' auth record gets skipped. Legacy encodings like that definitely trigger more spam flags in our testing too.

top.author: @beausecurity
top.text: I've been recommending @optery for a while as the best data deletion and privacy tool I've encountered. Don't want your home address, email, or phone number showing up on Google? Here's how it works: 1. Data Brokers and websites collect your data and make it easy for ANYONE to

comments.tweetTranslationZh: æˆ‘ä¸€ç›´åœ¨æ¨è @optery ä½œä¸ºæˆ‘é‡åˆ°çš„æœ€å¥½çš„æ•°æ®åˆ é™¤å’Œéšç§å·¥å…·ã€‚ä¸æƒ³è®©ä½ çš„å®¶åº­ä½å€ã€é‚®ç®±æˆ–ç”µè¯å·ç å‡ºç°åœ¨è°·æ­Œä¸Šï¼Ÿå®ƒçš„å·¥ä½œåŸç†æ˜¯è¿™æ ·çš„ï¼š1. æ•°æ®ç»çºªå•†å’Œç½‘ç«™æ”¶é›†ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œè®©ä»»ä½•äººéƒ½èƒ½è½»æ¾...

options.comment: The fact that we have to actively fight to keep our own data private is wild. Like paying protection money to the internet.
Data brokers are the silent economy most people don't realize exists. Your info gets sold dozens of times before you even know it's out there.
As someone building email tools, the amount of data floating around tied to email addresses is genuinely scary. Privacy-first should be the default, not the exception.

top.author: @venelinkochev
top.text: here is the power of being a solopreneur: I'm in talks with a big enterprise customer for ConvertHub they want to automate file conversions in their workflow I was missing a feature... so I built and shipped it between two of his emails the guy went from first email to

options.comment: The solopreneur superpower: build it while they're still explaining why they need it ğŸ˜…
This is exactly why small teams win - zero bureaucracy, direct customer feedback loop, and the ability to ship instantly. Enterprise software could learn from this agility.

As someone building tools for workflow automation, this hits different. The speed of solo development vs enterprise needs is such an interesting dynamic - you can literally out-ship their decision cycles.
